result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: The defendant shall not commit any criminal offenses; shall notify the Taylor County District Attorney's Office, as well as the Clerk of Court's office, of any change of address within ten days of said change.  Defendant shall comply with all of the terms of bond, which continues to remain in effect during the period of this agreement.

judgments.dispoDesc: Pursuant to an agreement the court granted the state's motion for a deferred entry of judgment of conviction on this charge for a period of 2 years.  Upon successful completion of the agreement the state will move to dismiss Count 1.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. 
All Costs are to be paid directly to the Taylor County Clerk of Courts Office in the amount of $50 a month beginning January 16, 2023. Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment being entered against you, tax intercept, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant shall attend AODA and follow through with any treatment recommendations.

Defendant shall attend counseling as deemed appropriate by the probation agent. Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

timeConds.notes:
The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  
Jail can be served with Huber Privileges.
Jail Sentence must begin no later than December 31, 2022.
Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew R. Moser

records.addlTxt: Request for Payment Plan, Agreement to Make Payments, and Order
In Court Notice to DE After Sentencing

1:30 PM  Defendant Andrew R. Moser in court.  Attorney Peter J. Prusinski in court for Andrew R. Moser.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Tlusty recites agreement for the record. Attorney Prusinski informed the court that DE is waiving the preliminary hearing.  Court found waiver given freely and voluntarily.  Information filed with the court. Court binds DE over for trial.  DE waived any further reading of the information. Defendant enter plea of guilty to count 1, 2, 4 and not guilty to count 3. Plea colloquy. Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists for the plea.  Court accepts the plea and makes findings of guilty. Statement made by Attorney Tlusty. Statement made by Attorney Prusinski. Court accepts the Deferred Entry of Judgment and holds count 1 open for a period of 2 years with the conditions that the DE will successfully complete the probation ordered in counts 2 and 4. Upon successful completion of the agreement the State will move to dismiss count 1. In counts 2 and 4 court orders a withheld sentence and placement on probation for 2 years with the following conditions. In count 4 only the court orders 45 days in jail with Huber Privileges to begin no later than December 31, 2022 at 4:30 pm. Court orders court costs on each count along with DNA sample and surcharge, AODA and to follow through with any recommended treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the probation agent. Costs are to be paid directly to the Taylor County Clerk of Courts office in the amount of $50 a month beginning January 16, 2023. Court dismisses but reads in count 3. Defendant has 0 days sentence credit.-JN
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure. Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

1:05 PM  Defendant Andrew R. Moser in court.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Peter J. Prusinski in court for Andrew R. Moser. Waived further reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Preliminary hearing requested with time limits waived freely and voluntarily.   The state requested signature bond in the amount of $2,000.00; booking. Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription. Court sets bond as requested.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
